item.source: A server status checker that works?

item.title: A server status checker that works?
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

Try

[code]

<?php $ip = "allexser.dnsalias.net"; //put your ipaddress here $port= "43594"; //the port number $sock = @fsockopen($ip, $port, $num, $error, 5); if (!$sock) //Checks the server's status (43594 = port) echo "Offline"; //When server status is offline, output this else echo "Online"; //Else, output this ?> [/code]

Read full topic
item.source: A server status checker that works?

item.title: A server status checker that works?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew1112 Andrew1112
item.description:
@Andrew1112 wrote:

I am making a website and i have this www.22salon.com/test_login/test3/client.php i have a code that looks like this

[code]

<?php $ip = "allexser.dnsalias.net"; //put your ipaddress here $port= "43594"; //the port number if (! $sock = @fsockopen($ip, $port, $num, $error, 5)) //Checks the server's status (43594 = port) { echo "Offline"; //When server status is offline, output this } else { echo "Online"; //Else, output this } ?> [/code]

but it doesnt work. it always shows offline. I know how to ue this inside an html website so dont tell me that i am doing something wrong in html. All i know is that the script is wrong. all help is appreciated.

Read full topic
item.source: A server status checker that works?
